body: Hello @onizmx, thank you for reporting this! Can you share which was the previous version you were using?

@ndyakov Hi!
We were using 9.11.0 which I assume just a version before?

@ndyakov Thank you! I will be away for the next few days so will try it early next week and give you an update!
Just to make sure, these will be the configuration I will try:
```
	client := redis.NewClusterClient(&redis.ClusterOptions{
		Addrs:            []string{address},
		DisableIndentity: true,
		ReadBufferSize:   4096, <-- new
		WriteBufferSize:  4096, <-- new
	})
	readOnlyClient := redis.NewClusterClient(&redis.ClusterOptions{
		Addrs:            []string{address},
		ReadOnly:         true,
		RouteRandomly:    true,
		RouteByLatency:   true,
		DisableIndentity: true,
		ReadBufferSize:   4096, <-- new
		WriteBufferSize:  4096, <-- new
	})
```

Yes @onizmx, this should use the same size as in 9.11 , keep in mind bigger buffers can be beneficial for speed with bigger commands. You can play around with the size while testing. Please let me know when you have more data and we can decide how to proceed.

@ndyakov Is there a similar workaround in cases where the client is created using `NewFailoverClient(...)`? I don't see any settings for read/write buffer sizes in the `FailoverOptions` struct, and from the data I see so far, the memory usage keeps growing in my service after the upgrade to 9.12 (from 9.11).

@moritzploss-k you are absolutely right we may have missed the `FailoverOptions`. Let me fix that and i will release a patch version tomorrow. Also, from the feedback so far I will reduce the default size to half of it, how does this sound?
great, thanks for the quick fix! ðŸ™Œ
Hello, @ndyakov Have you started working on it? If not, I have time to fix it now.
@cxljs i have and it is ready, just updating the readme. Thank you for the readiness to work on that!

issue.title: fix(options): Add buffer sizes to failover. Update README
issue.body:
- add missing buffer size to failover options
- half the default buffer size
- add section in readme related to buffer sizes

Fixes #3465
